result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI Cause Injury (2+) and PAC Cause Injury (2+). The defendant was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (2+) and the other charge, PAC Cause Injury (2+) was dismissed by the court.

  • David Reine Bundy was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (2+), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to Waukesha County.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations including costs of supervision during the term of probation.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Restitution must be paid during the term of probation.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA treatment, counseling and after care. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. No contact, directly or indirectly, with Caryn Macke. Defendant must not have any alcohol in his home. May not frequent any taverns. May go to restaurants that serve alcohol but may not consume alcohol there. DNA sample previously provided, however, defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Reine Bundy

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail. Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) to monitor - 524 S Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780).  Do not drive unless properly licensed.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 11/07/2014 - SCRAM MAY BE REMOVED. NO ALCOHOL - ZCI TO MONITOR. DEFENDANT MUST REPORT BI-WEEKLY
Status conference on December 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant David Reine Bundy in court with attorney Paul S. Crawford.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Maggie Techert.
Defense motions the court for modification of bail to remove SCRAM. Deft has been in counseling since September. The State stands silent to defense motion.

BTC: Bond modification is granted. SCRAM may be removed. No alc/ZCI. Must report bi-weekly  Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
ZCI

Status conference on November 7, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant David Reine Bundy in court with attorney Paul S. Crawford.  James D. Newlun appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense has filed bond modification motion as well.  Defense indicates that deft is in the process of scheduling treatment in Wauwatosa and defense is asking for a STC in 45 days. The State does not object. Defense is asking that the SCRAM be removed. The State objects to the request

BTC: Bond modification is denied. The Court will reconsider it if another motion is filed and deft is, in fact, in treatment  Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2014 at 09:00 am.
ZCI
